title: Error using resources
body:
I am trying to create a package that requires three external resources. They are gzipped upon download, but unzip as a file, not a directory. I am trying to use these in my package and am getting the following error (I have reduced the number of resources trying to be downloaded from 3 to 1 for troubleshooting purposes)

```
==> Installing pfamscan
==> Fetching file://~/.spack/manual_mirror/pfamscan/pfamscan-1.5.tar.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /.spack/manual_mirror/pfamscan/pfamscan-1.5.tar.gz
==> Fetching from file://~/.spack/manual_mirror/pfamscan/pfamscan-1.5.tar.gz failed.
==> Fetching http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/Pfam/Tools/OldPfamScan/PfamScan1.5/PfamScan.tar.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Fetching file://~/.spack/manual_mirror/pfamscan/Pfam-A.hmm.dat-1.5.gz
curl: (37) Couldn't open file /.spack/manual_mirror/pfamscan/Pfam-A.hmm.dat-1.5.gz
==> Fetching from file://~/.spack/manual_mirror/pfamscan/Pfam-A.hmm.dat-1.5.gz failed.
==> Fetching ftp://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/Pfam/current_release/Pfam-A.hmm.dat.gz
######################################################################## 100.0%
==> Staging archive: /home/las_thoma15/spack/var/spack/stage/pfamscan-1.5-zijjhq4sqejchuuzec6k4k33oppkuf32/PfamScan.tar.gz
==> Created stage in /home/las_thoma15/spack/var/spack/stage/pfamscan-1.5-zijjhq4sqejchuuzec6k4k33oppkuf32
==> Staging archive: /home/las_thoma15/spack/var/spack/stage/resource-Pfam-A.hmm.dat-zijjhq4sqejchuuzec6k4k33oppkuf32/Pfam-A.hmm.dat.gz
==> Created stage in /home/las_thoma15/spack/var/spack/stage/resource-Pfam-A.hmm.dat-zijjhq4sqejchuuzec6k4k33oppkuf32
==> Error: AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'rfind'
AttributeError: AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'rfind'

/home/las_thoma15/spack/lib/spack/spack/package.py:995, in do_stage:
     3                 raise ValueError("Can only stage concrete packages.")
     4     
     5             self.do_fetch(mirror_only)     # this will create the stage
  >> 6             self.stage.expand_archive()
     7     
     8             if not os.listdir(self.stage.path):
     9                 raise FetchError("Archive was empty for %s" % self.name)
```

The following is a snippet from the `package.py` of the resource spec:
```
    resource(
        name='Pfam-A.hmm.dat',
        url='ftp://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/Pfam/current_release/Pfam-A.hmm.dat.gz',
        sha256='512b96c6e3c95cdd78776d8524be888f44199533361348e11330e4718c9e500b',
        destination='Pfam-A.hmm.dat'
    )
```
Can anyone help me figure out what I should do differently?
